"Sin is: before God in despair not to want to be oneself, or before God in despair to want to be oneself" so said Soren Kierkergaard "The Sickness unto Death", Penguin Classics, p113.
 
 I've been thinking about this and I think what he's trying say is that sin is despair. Despair is lack of faith in God...
 
 
 
 Currently I have some time to write on these posts as I have leave from work to look after a sick relative; when she's not in immediate need. I was filled with despair at another prospect of another operation. I stopped daily prayers and going to Church. This despair, this lack of faith in God, I now realise is a sin.
 
 Despair must be a product of my lack of faith, my lack of trust in God. Regardless of what happens, I believe that trust in God is paramount.
 
 I'd be interested to hear from other Christians especially as to their thoughts on despair - is it the greatest of sins?

In a sense, I believe it is my failing to trust God...

 is he actively condeming my family to sickness
 or

 both of these are bad options.
 
 But, in reading a bit, and thinking about friendship the other day... and the trust that people who are friends must share, I feel that deep down I shouldn't be so full of despair, and put my faith in God.
 
 I have also been keenly aware of the hypocricy of debating on this forum when I myself am not showing the faith that I should.
 
 I am still trying to resolve these issues... I have promised my priest I'll go to Church two Fridays from now... at least for a talk being held by a visting cleric, but that is not a promise that I feel I can return to active church life.
 
 
 I thank you for your considered thoughts.

 That prize is us! What greater joy than that we should be able to spend eternity with Him. Do not focus on your sin. it will only cause you to sin more. instead let you mind wander on things of good repute, on the spiritual matters, on God. This will overcome your despair. He who is in you is greater than He who is in the world.

 What shocked me, perhaps more was just how quickly I lost faith. I was a regular church-goer; earlier this year I'd go Friday (for Complin Service), Saturday (for Vespers) and Sunday (for Divine Liturgy).
 
 Obviously then internally I am/was a weak Christian...
 
 This shocked me also because on Christmas Eve last, I was so full of faith that I stood up to a crazy dude...
 
 I got on the train at Parramatta and the next stop this man got on saying "I f*cking defile Christ, I ... defy Christmas, etc."
 
 I'm a fairly big bloke, and although I said nothing to him, I looked him square in the eye, and took my crucifix out from inside my shirt and hung it on the outside.
 
 He shut up after that. As I say, I'm a big bloke, and if pressed could have put him away.
 
 I find it easier to actually confront someone, but sickness is not something that you can head-butt.
 
 Despite being quite strong, externally, I was wearing a paper-thin faith.
